alert.note: Alert for Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 2:47PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN UNION COUNTY THROUGH 315 PM MDT... At 246 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Branson to near Des Moines to 11 miles north of Farley. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Des Moines, Folsom and Grenville. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 380 and 408. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.

area.areaDesc: Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County
